title: The Apprentice star Alan Sugar hits back at claims he knows Lottie Lion’s father
text:
Lord Alan Sugar has shut down claims he knows Lottie Lion’s father (Picture: BBC/PA)

Lord Alan Sugar has hit back at claims that he knows The Apprentice contestant Lottie Lion’s father, after it was claimed the candidate bragged about her family’s high profile connections.

Lottie’s father, Dominique Lion, runs Leaders For Business, who have boasted that Lord Sugar is just one of a number of inspirational speakers that can be hired.

However, the businessman took to social media on Tuesday afternoon to shut down the rumours and said he has ‘no clue who he is’ and that ‘he had no influence on her joining the candidate process’.

He tweeted: ‘I wish to clarify the RUBBISH quoted about my so called association with the father of @LottieLion1.

‘I have no clue who he is. I have never done any business with him. I have never met him and certainly he had no influence on her joining the candidate process.’

Lottie also recently came under fire for leaked WhatsApp messages which claimed she was ‘racist’.

According to The Sun, Lottie claimed she’d never spoken to a black person before, which Lubna debunked by sending a picture of the candidate with a friend alongside the dig: ‘I thought she’d never met a “black person”.’ ‘Seriously f*** off Lubna before I f****** knock you out at our press training,’ Lottie wrote back.

‘Lubna I f****** swear if you disrespect me again I will f*** you up, you embarrassing failure of a businesswoman.’

Lottie Lion has been rubbing other The Apprentice candidates up the wrong way (Picture: BBC)

Then she added: ‘Shut up Ghandi (sic) that doesn’t even make sense.’

The 19-year-old has also boasted about her privileged background and an insider has said that others in the process found her ‘unbearable’ and would go to any lengths to avoid sharing a vehicle with her as the series progressed.

Speaking to The Sun, the insider said that Lottie ‘managed to rub everyone up the wrong way from the start, particularly in the house where tempers were often running very high after tasks.’

It would be at this point that her background would rile other candidates in the process as Lottie ‘would brag about the country club she belonged to and she was always saying how you had to have loads of money to even be considered as a member.’

There was a perception that she was ‘looking down her nose at everyone else.’

The Apprentice continues Wednesday at 9pm on BBC One.
